Weak growth occurs with the following substrates with medium supplemented with yeast extract: Casamino acids, tryptone, pyruvate, ribose, xylose, arabinose, xylan and pectin. The following substrates are not utilized in the presence of yeast extract: crotonate, H2/CO2 plus acetate, lactate, glycerol, acetate, propionate, butyrate, malate, succinate, ethanol, methanol, 1-propanol, benzoate, hydroquinone, phenol and formate plus acetate. None of the following compounds is utilized as electron acceptor: sulfate, nitrate, sulfite, thiosulfate, fumarate, Fe(III)-NTA, PCE and TCE
Note: Growth is significantly stimulated when the organism is co-cultivated with hydrogenotrophic methanogens.

Name: Chloroflexus aggregans
Extended Metabolism: Aerobic growth in the dark occurs at full atmospheric oxygen tension. Thiamine and folic acid are required as growth factors. Good carbon sources are yeast extract and Casamino Acids. Simple organic compounds such as intermediates of the citric acid cycle, glutamate, and aspartate are utilized as sole carbon sources only under phototrophic conditions. The major quinone is menaquinone 10. A trace amount of menaquinone 4 is also present

Name: Athalassotoga saccharophila
Extended Metabolism: It utilized Fe(III), thiosulfate or l-cystine as electron acceptor for growth, and yeast extract, peptone or a variety of sugars as carbon and energy sources.

Name: Methanocella conradii
Extended Metabolism: Strain HZ254(T) utilized H(2)/CO(2) but not formate for growth and methane production

Name: Halopiger goleimassiliensis
Extended Metabolism: Cells are positive for catalase, oxidase and lysine decarboxylase production and negative for urease, arginine dihydrolase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophanase, phosphatase, β-galactosidase, D-mannitol, sacharose, starch, dextrose, and D-fructose fermentation. The following substrates are utilized as single carbon and energy sources for growth: pyruvate, D-glucose, D-mannose, D-ribose, D-xylose, maltose, sucrose, lactose, casamino acids, bacto-peptone, bacto-tryptone, and yeast extract. Tween 80, gelatin, and lipids from egg yolk are hydrolysed, whereas urea, starch, and casein are not. Methyl red, Voges–Proskauer, Simmons' citrate tests, and H2S production are negative.

Name: Petrotoga olearia
Extended Metabolism: Thiosulfate, cystine and sulfate cannot be used as electron acceptors. Metabolism shifts to alanine production in the absence of elemental sulfur. Pyruvate, peptone and papaic digest of soybean meal support growth in the absence of yeast extract. In the presence of yeast extract, a variety of organic compounds are used, including xylose, arabinose and cellobiose

Name: Saccharomonospora viridis
Extended Metabolism: Members of S. viridis are apparently able to metabolize pentachlorophenol but not other chlorophenols [14]. It was suggested that S. viridis metabolizes PCP by conjugation to form a more polar transformation product, but, unlike other PCP-degrading bacteria, the organism is incapable of effecting total degradation of the xenobiotic.

Name: Acetomicrobium thermoterrenum
Extended Metabolism: Ferments citrate, fumarate, malate, pyruvate, glutamate, a-ketoglutarate, tartrate, starch, pectin, glucose, fructose, mannose, inositol, glycerol, protein extracts, and Casamino Acids. Compounds that are not used are xylose, galactose, lactose, sucrose, maltose, rhamnose, raffinose, cellulose, carboxymethyl cellulose, gum arabic, malonate, succinate, glutarate, and lactate. Sulfide is produced when the organism is grown in the presence of elemental sulfur, thiosulfate, and cystine. Sulfate, sulfite, and nitrate are not reduced. Growth is inhibited by H,.

Name: Syntrophothermus lipocalidus
Extended Metabolism: The cells can grow in pure culture only on crotonate. In syntrophic association with hydrogenotrophic methanogens, the organism can utilize saturated fatty acids with 4 to 10 carbon atoms by β-oxidation. Isobutyrate is also utilized by isomerization to butyrate.
Note: syntrophic in co-culture with a thermophilic hydrogenotrophic methanogen

Name: Meiothermus cerbereus
Extended Metabolism: All strains are oxidase positive and catalase negative. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite. a- and P-galactosidase positive. Elastin, fibrin, casein, and hide powder azure are hydrolyzed. Degradation of arbutin and esculin is positive. Strains GY-lT and GY-5 utilize D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, Dgalactose, D-melibiose, D-cellobiose, D-trehalose, maltose, lactose, sucrose, pyruvate, L-glutamate, and L-proline. Strains GY-lT and GY-5 do not hydrolyze starch or utilize D-raffinose, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, D-xylose, glycerol, ribitol, succinate, malate, citrate, myo-inositol, L-asparagine, L-serine, L-glutamine, L-arabinose, L-rhamnose, and L-arginine.

Name: Thermodesulfovibrio thiophilus
Extended Metabolism: With sulfate as electron acceptor, the electron donors are lactate, hydrogen (in the presence of acetate), formate (in the presence of acetate) and pyruvate. Organic substrates are oxidized incompletely to acetate. Malate, fumarate, succinate, methanol, 1- propanol, 1-butanol, benzoate, phenol, acetate, propionate and butyrate are not used as electron donors. With lactate as electron donor, the electron acceptors are sulfate, sulfite, thiosulfate and Fe(III) NTA.

Name: Melioribacter roseus
Extended Metabolism: In the course of aerobic or anaerobic growth strain P3M-2T used the following substrates: yeast extract, peptone, beef extract, glucose, mannose, rhamnose, arabinose, cellobiose, xylose, trehalose, ribose, maltose, fructose, lactose, dextrin, dextran, lichenan, agarose, xylan, glycogen, gelatin, starch, microcrystalline cellulose (Avicel), carboxymethyl cellulose (CMC), xanthan gum, corn leaves, cotton wool, paper napkin, formate and acetate. No growth was observed on galactose, sucrose, pyruvate, filter paper, birch and fir sawdust, pectin, lignin, beta-keratin(feathers), polyvinyl alcohol, tetradecane, lactate, propionate, ethanol, propanol, butanol, mannitol or sorbitol

Name: Alicyclobacillus kakegawensis
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase-negative. Catalase weakly positive. nitrate-reduction, Voges–Proskauer test and indole production are negative. Aesculin and arbutin are hydrolyzed, but gelatin, phenylalanine, starch and tyrosine are not. Acid is produced from d-arabinose, l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, rhamnose, mannitol, sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, amygdalin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, sucrose, trehalose, xylitol, β-gentiobiose, d-turanose, d-lyxose and d-arabitol. Variable acid production from erythritol, inositol, melezitose and d-tagatose

Name: Alicyclobacillus macrosporangiidus
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase-negative. Catalase weakly positive. nitrate-reduction, Voges–Proskauer test and indole production are negative. Aesculin is hydrolyzed, but gelatin, arbutin, phenylalanine, starch and tyrosine are not. Acid is produced from glycerol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, rhamnose, sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, salicin, maltose, lactose, sucrose, trehalose, xylitol, β-gentiobiose, d-lyxose and d-arabitol.

Name: Alicyclobacillus contaminans
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase- and catalase-negative. nitrate-reduction, Voges–Proskauer test and indole production are negative. Gelatin and aesculin are hydrolyzed, but phenylalanine, starch and tyrosine are not, and arbutin is variable. Acid is produced from glycerol, l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, mannitol, cellobiose, maltose, sucrose and trehalose.

Name: Tepidiphilus thermophilus
Note: Formerly known as Petrobacter sp. JHK30

Name: Truepera radiovictrix
Extended Metabolism: Chemoorganotrophic, aerobic and respiratory; homolactic fermentation takes place. Sugars, organic acids and amino acids are used as carbon and energy sources. Extremely ionizing radiation resistant

Name: Chroococcidiopsis sp
Extended Metabolism: Fixes carbon dioxide under a high concentration of carbon dioxide. The strain can also survive under the existence of various NOx or SOx concentrations, and utilize them as a nitrogen or sulfur source

Name: Haloterrigena hispanica
Extended Metabolism: Chemo-organotrophic and aerobic. Oxidase- and catalase-positive. Indole formation is positive. nitrate-reduction is observed but nitrite reduction is not. Gelatin, starch, casein, and Tweens 20, 40 and 60 are not hydrolyzed. The following substrates are utilized for growth: glycerol, sodium acetate, sodium propionate and sodium citrate. Glucose, mannose, rhamnose, fructose, sucrose, galactose, trehalose, ribose, xylose, cellobiose and arabinose are not utilized for growth.

Name: Haloterrigena thermotolerans
Extended Metabolism: Nitrogen and carbon source: Casamino acids. Sugars (glucose, fructose, sucrose, ribose and others) and glycerol are not used as carbon sources and do not give rise to acid production. Does not produce amylase. Reduces nitrate to nitrite

Name: Thermus chliarophilus
Extended Metabolism: All strains are oxidase positive and catalase negative. Casein, elastin, fibrin, gelatin, hide powder azure, and starch are degraded. Nitrate is reduced to nitrite. or-Galactosidase and P-galactosidase positive. D-Glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, D-galactose, sucrose, maltose, D-cellobiose, D-trehalose, lactose, D-melibiose, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, pyruvate, L-glutamate, L-asparagine, L-serine, L-glutamine, and L-proline are utilized by strain ALT-8T; D-xylose, L-arabinose, L-rhamnose, D-raffinose, glycerol, meso-erythritol, galactitol, ribitol, myo-inositol, acetate, succinate, citrate, salicin, and acetamide are not utilized.

Name: Thermosporothrix narukonensis
Extended Metabolism: Avicel, CM-cellulose, xylan, chitin, starch, and gelatine are hydrolyzed. Catalase activity is positive. L-Arabinose, D-xylose, D-glucose, L-rhamnose, raffinose and inositol can be utilized as sole carbon sources.

Name: Mahella australiensis
Extended Metabolism: fermented arabinose, cellobiose, fructose, galactose, glucose, mannose, sucrose, xylose and yeast extract. Glucose was fermented mainly into lactate, formate, hydrogen and CO(2). The major end product of pyruvate fermentation was acetate together with H(2) and CO(2). Thiosulfate, sulfate, elemental sulfur and nitrate were not used as terminal electron acceptors.

Name: Alicyclobacillus pomorum
Extended Metabolism: Growth factors are not required, but growth is further increased by adding yeast extract to the inorganic medium. The generation time is 1·5 h. Oxidase- and catalase-positive, but does not reduce nitrate to nitrite. Aesculin, gelatin and starch are hydrolyzed, but arbutin, phenylalanine and tyrosine are not. Acid is produced from glycerol, ribose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, mannitol, methyl-α-d-glucoside, amygdalin, aesculin, salicin, maltose, sucrose, trehalose, d-turanose, d-tagatose and 5-ketogluconate.

Name: Alicyclobacillus shizuokensis
Extended Metabolism: catalase-positive. Oxidase and nitrate-reduction are negative. Voges–Proskauer test and indole production are negative. Aesculin and arbutin are hydrolyzed, but gelatin, phenylalanine, starch and tyrosine are not. Acid is produced from l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, mannitol, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose and β-gentiobiose.

Name: Ferroplasma thermophilum
Extended Metabolism: capable of chemomixotrophic growth on ferrous iron and yeast extract

Name: Thermobifida fusca
Extended Metabolism: Catalase, strong positive; oxidase, negative ; acid production from D-glucose, weak positive ; nitrate-reduction, negative. Proteolytic activity evidenced by ability to hydrolyze casein, gelatin, keratin and elastin, The following compounds are also degraded : starch, agar, pectin, cellulose, xylan, arbutin and aesculin. Chitin, xanthine, hypoxanthine, guanine and tyrosine not degraded. Carbon source utilization pattern characterized by the ability to utilize D-galactose and lactose, but not D-ribose and D-xylose.

Name: Geotoga subterranea
Extended Metabolism: Yeast extract is required for growth. Stimulated by the addition of tryptone (0.05%). Hydrogen does not inhibit growth. Reduce elemental sulfur to hydrogen sulfide.

Name: Chloroflexus islandicus
Extended Metabolism: The major quinone is menaquinone-10. Carbon and energy sources used under chemoheterotrophic conditions are acetate, glucose, fructose, glycerol, yeast extract, casamino acids, soytone, casein hydrolysate and sucrose. Carbon sources used under photoheterotrophic conditions are glutamate, aspartate, glycylglycine, acetate, pyruvate, succinate, fructose, glucose, sucrose, mannitol, methanol, ethanol, glycerol, yeast extract, soytone, casamino acids and casein hydrolysate. Reduced sulphur is not required. Ammonium chloride served as a nitrogen source. Folic acid is required as a growth factor.

Name: Thermanaerovibrio acidaminovorans
Extended Metabolism: Strain Su883 is able to grow by oxidative decarboxylation of succinate to propionate. A mechanism for reductive propionate formation could be excluded. Glutamate, α-ketoglutarate, histidine, arginine, ornithine, lysine, and threonine are fermented to acetate and propionate. Serine, pyruvate, alanine, glucose, fructose, xylose, glycerol and citrate are fermented to acetate. Branched-chain amino acids are converted to branched-chain fatty acids. Hydrogen is the only reduced end product. The growth and the substrate conversion are strongly enhanced by co-cultivation with methanogens, e.g., M. thermoautotrophicum

Name: Chloracidobacterium thermophilum
Extended Metabolism: growth is restricted to a few carbon sources, and amino acids can serve as the sole carbon and nitrogen sources. Beneficial growth nutrients are 2-oxoglutarate, mannose and ethanol. Growth is possible with all combinations of amino acids as long as l-leucine, l-isoleucine, l-valine, l-lysine and a reduced sulfur source are included. Bicarbonate and vitamin B12 are also essential medium components. Weak growth in the dark occurs with mannose, 2-oxoglutarate and amino acids. Unable to grow on nitrate (2.5 mM), ammonia (1 mM) and 80 % (v/v) dinitrogen gas. Thioglycolate, l-methionine, l-cysteine/cystine, sulfur and thiosulfate can serve as sulfur sources.

Name: Methanomethylovorans thermophila
Extended Metabolism: Methanol and mono-, di- and trimethylamine were used as substrates, but H2/CO2, formate, acetate, propanol, dimethyl sulfide and methanethiol were not.

Name: Thermosporothrix hazakensis
Extended Metabolism: Casein, cellulose, xylan and chitin are hydrolyzed, while starch and gelatin are not. Catalase positive. D-Xylose, D-glucose, sucrose, L-rhamnose, inositol and mannitol are utilized as sole carbon sources.

Name: Haloterrigena saccharevitans
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase- and catalase-positive. Indole formation is negative. Nitrate is reduced without production of gas. H2S is produced from thiosulfate. Tweens 40 and 80 are hydrolyzed. Gelatin, starch and casein are not hydrolyzed. The following substrates are utilized for growth: glycerol, arginine, ornithine, acetate, fumarate, malate, propionate, pyruvate, succinate and lactate. Fructose, glucose, mannose, starch, arabinose, lactose, mannitol, rhamnose, sorbitol, maltose, galactose, D-ribose, sucrose, D-xylose, glutamate, lysine, aspartate, glycine, alanine and citrate are not utilized for growth. Acid is only produced from glycerol.

Name: Halorhabdus rudnickae
Extended Metabolism: All strains hydrolyze esculin. None of the strains assimilated lactose, sucrose, N-acetylglucosamine, glycerol, sorbitol, lactate, acetate, pyruvate, citrate, formate, D-glucuronate, L-alanine, L-lysine, L-proline, L-serine, L-phenylalanine, gelatin and peptone.

Name: Haloterrigena turkmenica
Extended Metabolism: Yeast extract is carbon source

Name: Meiothermus hypogaeus
Extended Metabolism: Sulfur compounds are not required for growth in liquid medium. Utilizes d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, d-galactose, melibiose, maltose, lactose, trehalose, sucrose, cellobiose, d-xylose, glycerol, pyruvate, l-asparagine and l-glutamate as carbon and energy sources, but not raffinose, d-arabinose, l-rhamnose, ribitol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, citrate, succinate, malate, myo-inositol, l-glutamine, l-serine, l-proline or l-arginine.

Name: Natranaerobius thermophilus
Extended Metabolism: Strain JW/NM-WN-LFT utilized fructose, cellobiose, ribose, trehalose, trimethylamine, pyruvate, Casamino acids, acetate, xylose and peptone as carbon and energy sources. Fumarate (20 mM), S2O3(2-) (20 mM), NO3- (20 mM) and iron(III) citrate (20 mM) were utilized as electron acceptors. During growth on sucrose, the isolate produced acetate and formate as major fermentation products.

Name: Heliobacterium modesticaldum
Extended Metabolism: row phototrophically by photoassimilating pyruvate, lactate, and acetate, or chemotrophically on pyruvate. Sugars and other organic acids are not utilized. Ammonia, glutamine, and N2 serve as nitrogen sources. Biotin is required. Thiosulfate, methionine, or cysteine required as biosynthetic sulfur sources.

Name: Halorubrum coriense
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase and catalase positive. Amino acids are required for growth.

Name: Heliothrix oregonensis
Extended Metabolism: exhibited a light-dependent uptake of acetate and appeared to grow as a photoheterotroph in natural habitats.

Name: Haloterrigena longa
Extended Metabolism: Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Anaerobic growth with nitrate, arginine or DMSO does not occur. nitrate-reduction to nitrite is not observed. H2S is produced from Na2S2O3. Positive for indole formation. Tweens 20, 40 and 60 are hydrolyzed but Tween 80 is not. Negative for caseinase, amylase and gelatinase. The following substrates are utilized as carbon sources: glucose, sucrose, maltose, pyruvate and acetate. Fructose, sorbose, xylose, galactose, mannose, D-ribose, lactose, mannitol and sorbitol are not utilized as carbon sources. Acid is produced in unbuffered medium from glucose and sucrose

Name: Petrotoga sibirica
Extended Metabolism: Thiosulfate, cystine and sulfate cannot be used as electron acceptors. Metabolism shifts to alanine production in the absence of elemental sulfur. Yeast extract is required for growth. In the presence of yeast extract, a variety of compounds are used, but some, such as xylose, arabinose and cellobiose, are not

Name: Haloferax elongans
Extended Metabolism: The following substrates are used as carbon sources: glucose, glycerol, maltose, sucrose and trehalose. Acid is produced from glucose, glycerol, maltose, sucrose and trehalose. The following substrates are not used as carbon sources: ethanol, fumarate, galactose, glycine, lactose, mannitol, mannose, raffinose, xylose, l-arginine, l-histidine, l-lysine, l-ornithine and d-sorbitol.

Name: Alicyclobacillus acidiphilus
Extended Metabolism: Does not hydrolyze gelatin or starch. Tyrosine and phenylalanine are not degraded. Does not reduce nitrate to nitrite and does not form indole. Does not form gas from glucose. Acids are formed from D-arabinose, L-arabinose, arubtin, cellobiose, aesculin, D-fructose, galactose, β-gentiobiose, D-glucose, lactose, maltose, D-mannose, methyl α-D- glucoside, melezitose, D-raffinose, ribose, sucrose, salicin, sorbitol, L-sorbose, trehalose, D-turanose and D- xylose. Does not produce acid from N-acetylglucosamine, adonitol, amygdalin, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, gluconate, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, 5- ketogluconate, D-lyxose, mannitol, melibiose, methyl α-D-mannoside, β-methylxyloside, rhamnose, starch, D-tagatose or L-xylose

Name: Anaerolinea thermolimosa
Extended Metabolism: Yeast extract is required for growth. In the presence of 0.01 % yeast extract, growth and substrate utilization are observed with glucose, mannose, galactose, fructose, ribose, xylose, arabinose, sucrose, raffinose, tryptone and pyruvate. Weak growth occurs with the following substrates with medium supplemented with 0.01 % yeast extract: Casamino acids, starch, xylan, pectin and peptone. The following substrates are not utilized in the presence of 0.01 % yeast extract: crotonate, H2/CO2 plus acetate, betaine, lactate, glycerol, fumarate, acetate, propionate, butyrate, malate, succinate, ethanol, methanol, 1-propanol, ethylene glycol, hydroquinone, phenol, benzoate and formate plus acetate. Sulphate, sulphite, thiosulphate, elemental sulphur, nitrate, fumarate and Fe(III)-NTA are not utilized as electron acceptors.
Note: Growth is significantly stimulated when the organism is co-cultivated with hydrogenotrophic methanogens.

Name: Haloterrigena mahii
Extended Metabolism: Casamino acids serve as nitrogen and carbon sources. Acid is produced from fructose, glycerol and sorbitol. H2S is produced from cysteine but not from Na2S2O3

Name: Halorhabdus utahensis
Extended Metabolism: Ferments glucose. Sulfur stimulates fermentative growth.

Name: Haloferax denitrificans
Extended Metabolism: It reduces nitrate to nitrite, nitrous oxide, and dinitrogen when grown in the presence of 0.5% nitrate. Only dinitrogen accumulates when it is grown in the presence of 0.1% nitrate. Grows aerobically, but not anaerobically, in a mineral-salts medium containing 0.005% yeast extract, ammonium as the nitrogen source, and suitable carbon and energy sources such as D-glucose, D-galactose, D-fructose, maltose, sucrose, acetate, citrate, fumarate, glycerol, lactate, a-ketoglutarate, malate, succinate or pyruvate.

Name: Methanolinea tarda
Extended Metabolism: The strain utilized H2 and formate for growth and methane production

Name: Geotoga petraea
Extended Metabolism: Yeast extract is required for growth. Not stimulated by the addition of tryptone (0.05%). Hydrogen inhibits growth. Reduce elemental sulfur to hydrogen sulfide.

Name: Roseiflexus castenholzii
Extended Metabolism: It was able to grow photoheterotrophically under anaerobic light conditions and also chemoheterotrophically under aerobic dark conditions.

Name: Thioprofundum lithotrophicum
Note: Also known as gamma proteobacterium KT-2008

Name: Haloferax mucosum
Extended Metabolism: The following substrates are used as carbon sources: glucose, glycerol, maltose, sucrose and trehalose. Acid is produced from glucose, glycerol, maltose, sucrose and trehalose. The following substrates are not used as carbon sources: ethanol, fumarate, galactose, glycine, lactose, mannitol, mannose, raffinose, xylose, l-arginine, l-histidine, l-lysine, l-ornithine and d-sorbitol

Name: Alicyclobacillus sacchari
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase, catalase and nitrate-reduction are negative. Voges–Proskauer test and indole production are negative. Arbutin, gelatin and starch are hydrolyzed, but aesculin, phenylalanine and tyrosine are not. Acid is produced from glycerol, l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, methyl β-xyloside, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, rhamnose, mannitol, methyl α-d-glucoside, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, d-raffinose, glycogen, β-gentiobiose and d-turanose

Name: Alicyclobacillus acidoterrestris
Extended Metabolism: Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Starch is hydrolyzed but gelatin is not. d-Mannitol, d-glucose, d-fructose, maltose, d-mannose, d-raffinose and d-sucrose are utilized. Nitrate is reduced to nitrite. Urease, indole and H2S are not produced.

Name: Meiothermus granaticius
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase, catalase and DNAse positive. Nitrate is reduced to nitrite. Hippurate, arbutin and gelatine are hydrolyzed, but xylan is not. Degradation of esculin, starch and casein is weakly positive. Alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C 4), esterase lipase (C 8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, galactosidase, -glucosidase and mannosidase test positive in API ZYM; other activities test negative. d-glucose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-mannose, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-arabinose, sucrose, maltose, lactose, d-cellobiose, d-trehalose, d-mannitol, myo-inositol, lactate, acetate, succinate, malate, fumarate and l-glutamine are assimilated; l-rhamnose, l-fucose, l-sorbose, d-arabinose, d-raffinose, d-melizitose, glycerol, ribitol, xylitol,d-sorbitol, erythritol,d-arabitol, l-arabitol, -ketoglutarate, pyruvate, citrate, benzoate, formate, d-gluconate, d-glucoronate, aspartate, glutamate, l-alanine, l-aspargine, glycine, l-histidine, l-lysine, l-proline, l-arginine, l-serine, l-valine, l-phenylalanine, lleucine, l-isoleucine, l-ornithine, methionine and l-threonine are not assimilated.

Name: Deinococcus geothermalis
Extended Metabolism: Yeast extract is not required for growth. Oxidase and catalase positive. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite. a-Galactosidase negative and P-galactosidase positive. Strain AG-3aT degrades casein, gelatin, hide powder azure, hippurate, arbutin, and starch. Strain RSPS-2a does not degrade starch. Strain AG-3aT utilizes D-cellobiose, D-trehalose, lactose, maltose, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, D-mannose, L-rhamnose, sucrose, Dxylose, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, glycerol, L-asparagine, L-glutamate, L-glutamine, L-proline, L-serine, malate, pyruvate, and succinate. Strain RSPS-2a utilizes all of these compounds except lactose, L-rhamnose, and D-mannitol. The strains do not utilize D-raffinose, D-melibiose, L-arabinose, myo-inositol, ribitol, L-arginine, and citrate

Name: Natronorubrum sulfidifaciens
Extended Metabolism:
Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Anaerobic growth with nitrate, arginine and DMSO does not occur. nitrate-reduction to nitrite is observed. H2S is produced from Na2S2O3. Positive for indole formation. Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are not hydrolyzed. Negative for caseinase, amylase and gelatinase. The following substrates are utilized as carbon sources: glucose, sucrose, maltose, glycerol, lactate, malate, succinate, acetate, pyruvate, fumarate and glutamate. Mannose, galactose, fructose, sorbose, xylose, D-ribose, lactose, starch, mannitol, sorbitol, citrate, glycine, L-alanine, L-arginine, L-aspartic acid,
L-lysine and L-ornithine are not utilized as carbon sources.

Name: Alicyclobacillus montanus
Extended Metabolism: The final electron acceptor is Fe3+ under anaerobic conditions and oxidizes Fe2+ under aerobic conditions in the presence of organic and inorganic carbon sources. Shows heterotrophic, autotrophic and mixotrophic metabolism, requiring an inorganic source of electrons (Fe2+) for growth. Acid is produced from glycerol, l-arabinose, d-galactose, glucose, cellobiose, d-fructose, rhamnose, lactose, melibiose and trehalose.

Name: Halarchaeum nitratireducens
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase-negative. H2S is not produced from thiosulfate. Indole formation is negative. Reduces nitrate and nitrite under aerobic conditions. Does not hydrolyse starch, gelatin, Tween 80, cellulose, mannan and casein. Capable of using l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, d-xylose or sodium succinate as a sole carbon substrate. Maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, raffinose, ribitol, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, trehalose, sodium acetate, sodium citrate, sodium α-ketoglutarate, sodium dl-lactate, sodium pyruvate, l-alanine, l-arginine chloride, sodium l-aspartate, sodium l-glutamate and l-lysine chloride are not utilized as carbon sources.

Name: Halobacterium jilantaiense
Extended Metabolism: Growth is chemoorganotrophic and aerobic. Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Grows anaerobically in the presence of L-arginine, nitrate and DMSO. nitrate-reduction to nitrite is observed and H2S is produced from cysteine. Indole formation is positive. Tween 80 and starch are not hydrolyzed. Casein and gelatin are hydrolyzed. Amino acids are required for growth. Starch is not hydrolyzed. Glucose, galactose, sucrose, maltose, fructose, sorbose, xylose, mannose, lactose, D-ribose, mannitol and sorbitol are not utilized in 7–10 days. Glycerol is utilized without acid production.

Name: Natronomonas pharaonis
Extended Metabolism: Nitrogen sources: glutamate, casamino acids. Ammonium and nitrate not utilized. Carbon sources: pyruvate, fumarate, formate, butyrate (all in presence of glutamate). Sugars are not utilized; starch, casein and Tween are not hydrolyzed. Vitamins not required. Dissimilatory nitrate-reduction negative. Gelatin liquefaction, phosphatase, catalase, oxidase, sulfide formation from thiosulfate, and indole formation from tryptophane positive.

Name: Natronorubrum bangense
Extended Metabolism: Amino acids are utilized. Growth is stimulated by many sugars (glucose, fructose, maltose, sucrose and lactose). Indole is formed from tryptophan. Starch and casein are not hydrolyzed. H,S is not produced from thiosulfate. Gelatin is not liquefied

Name: Natronorubrum tibetense
Extended Metabolism:
Amino acids are utilized. The growth is stimulated by many sugars (glucose, fructose maltose, sucrose and lactose). Indole is formed from
tryptophan. Starch and casein are not hydrolyzed. H2S
is not produced from thiosulfate. Gelatin is liquefied.
Tween 40 and 60 are hydrolyzed but Tween 80 is not.

Name: Halorhabdus tiamatea
Extended Metabolism: used glucose, fructose and xylose, showed β-glucosidase activity, reduced nitrate and were capable of anaerobic growth with S0 or KNO3

Name: Halobellus limi
Extended Metabolism: Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Does not grow under anaerobic conditions with nitrate, arginine or DMSO. Nitrate reduction to nitrite is observed. Formation of gas from nitrate is negative. H2S is produced from sodium thiosulfate. Indole formation is negative. Does not hydrolyse starch, gelatin, Tween 80 or casein. The following substrates are utilized as single carbon and energy sources for growth: d-glucose, d-mannose, d-galactose, maltose, sucrose, lactose, glycerol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, pyruvate and dl-lactate. The following substrates are utilized as single carbon, nitrogen or energy sources for growth: glycine, l-alanine and l-glutamate. The following substrates are not utilized as single carbon and energy sources for growth: d-fructose, l-sorbose, d-ribose, d-xylose, starch, acetate, succinate, l-malate, fumarate and citrate. The following substrates are not utilized as single carbon, nitrogen or energy sources for growth: l-arginine, l-aspartate and l-lysine. Acid is produced from d-glucose, d-mannose, d-galactose, sucrose and lactose.

Name: Halobaculum magnesiiphilum
Extended Metabolism: H2S is not produced from sodium thiosulfate. Indole is produced from tryptophan. Nitrate reduction to nitrite is observed. Nitrite was reduced. Catalase- and oxidase-negative. Gelatin, starch, casein and Tween 80 are not hydrolysed. β-Galactosidase-, phosphatase-, urease-, lysine and ornithine decarboxylases-negative. Does not grow anaerobically with nitrate or DMSO. Does not ferment arginine. Utilizes glucose, glycerol, mannitol, sucrose, sorbitol, trehalose, acetate and pyruvate as single carbon substrates. Arabinose, fructose, galactose, lactose, maltose, mannose, ribose, xylose, citrate, fumarate, lactate, malate, succinate, alanine, arginine, aspartate, glutamate, glycine and lysine are not utilized as carbon sources. Acid is produced from glucose, glycerol, mannitol, sucrose and trehalose. Able to utilize complex carbon sources such as neopeptone.

Name: Methanobacterium ivanovii
Extended Metabolism:
Hydrogen and carbon dioxide can serve as a substrate for growth and meth ane pro duction. Neither growth nor methane production is detectable within two weeks when
formate, methanol, 2-propanol, methylamine, glucose and acetate was used as substrate. Acetate, however, is readily assimilated for cell carbon synthesis while growing on
H2C02, Ammonia and glutamine can be used as nitrogen source while sulfide, elemental sulfur, cysteine and methionine can serve as sulfur source . Sulfate, thiosulfate, sulfite or dithionite does not serve as sulfur source.

Name: Methanocella arvoryzae
Extended Metabolism: The isolate utilized H(2)/CO(2) and formate for growth and methane production.

Name: Methanococcus aeolicus
Extended Metabolism: autotrophically by reduction of CO2 to CH4, with H2 (or formate) as electron donor. Acetate, methanol, methylamines, ethanol, 1-propanol and 2-propanol are not catabolized

Name: Methanoculleus submarinus
Extended Metabolism: grew with hydrogen or formate as a catabolic substrate. Cells required acetate as a carbon source. Yeast extract and peptones were not required but increased the growth rate.

Name: Methanosarcina flavescens sp
Extended Metabolism: grew autotrophically on H2 plus CO2, and additionally cells could utilize acetate, methanol, moni-, di- and trimethylamine as carbon and energy sources; however, growth or methanogenesis on formate was not observed. Yeast extract and vitamins stimulated growth but were not mandatory.

Name: Curvularia protuberata
Note: It forms a mutualistic relationship with Dichanthelium lanuginosum (panic grass) and Curvularia thermal tolerance virus that allows the grass to grow in soils that are far warmer than it normally tolerates

Name: Haloferax larsenii
Extended Metabolism: The following substrates are utilized for growth: glucose, glycerol, mannose, starch, maltose, sucrose, glutamate, alanine, ornithine, fumarate, malate, pyruvate, succinate and lactate. Arabinose, lactose, mannitol, rhamnose, sorbitol, galactose, ribose, xylose, arginine, lysine, aspartate, glycine, acetate, propionate and citrate are not utilized for growth. Acid is produced from glycerol and maltose and, to a lesser extent, on glucose, fructose and sucrose.

Name: Alicyclobacillus fastidiosus
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase-negative. Catalase-positive. nitrate-reduction, Voges–Proskauer test and indole production are negative. Gelatin is hydrolyzed, but aesculin, arbutin, phenylalanine, starch and tyrosine are not. Acid is produced from d-arabinose, l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, methyl β-xyloside, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, rhamnose, inositol, mannitol, melibiose, trehalose, d-raffinose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose and l-fucose.

Name: Haloterrigena salifodinae
Extended Metabolism: Does not reduce nitrate to nitrite, and no gas is produced. The following substrates are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources: D-glucose, Dmannose, D-galactose, sucrose, lactose, starch, glycerol, acetate, pyruvate, lactate, succinate, L-malate, fumarate, citrate, L-aspartate, L-glutamate, L-lysine and L-ornithine. Acid production is negative for D-glucose, D-mannose, sucrose, lactose and glycerol as sole carbon and energy source. No growth is observed in D-fructose, L-sorbose, D-ribose, D-xylose, maltose, mannitol, sorbitol, glycine, L-alanine and L-arginine.

Name: Nautilia profundicola
Extended Metabolism: growth occurs with molecular hydrogen or formate as the electron donor and elemental sulfur as the electron acceptor, producing hydrogen sulfide. Fumarate and pyruvate are not used as electron donors. Oxygen, thiosulfate, sulfate, fumarate, arsenate and nitrate are not used as electron acceptors. Ammonium, nitrate, peptone and yeast extract are used as sources of nitrogen. Urea is not used as a nitrogen source. Heterotrophic and mixotrophic growth occurs with formate as a source of carbon. Acetate, fumarate, lactate, pyruvate and succinate are not utilized as sole sources of carbon.

Name: Haloarcula quadrata
Extended Metabolism: Growth occurs on glucose, sucrose and maltose as single carbon and energy sources. Growth stimulation further observed by galactose, mannitol, sorbitol, glycerol, succinate and pyruvate. Acid is produced in the presence of glucose, galactose, sucrose, xylose or ribose. Grows anaerobically in the presence of nitrate with formation of nitrite and gas. No anaerobic growth in the presence of arginine. Starch hydrolysed. No hydrolysis of gelatin, casein, Tween 20 or Tween 80. Indole is not produced. Oxidase- and catalase-positive.

Name: Alicyclobacillus cycloheptanicus
Extended Metabolism: Acid is formed from the following carbon sources in an API CH50 test system: D-arabinose, ribose, D-xylose, galactose, glucose, fructose, mannose, sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, amygdalin, D-lyxose, L-fucose, D-arabitol, and 5 keto-gluconate. Esculin is hydrolyzed.

Name: Flexistipes sinusarabici
Extended Metabolism: Heterotrophic growth on yeast extract, meat extract, peptone, and tryptone. Weak growth on acetate and casamino acids.

Name: Natrinema versiforme
Extended Metabolism: Anaerobic growth in the presence of nitrate. Carbon sources: Casamino acids and several sugars, such as fructose, glucose, glycerol (with strong acid formation), galactose, maltose, mannose, d-ribose, sucrose and d-xylose, but not lactose. Reduces nitrate and forms gas. Forms sulfide from sulfur or thiosulfate. Forms indole. Does not hydrolyze gelatin or casein.

Name: Deinococcus murrayi
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase and catalase positive. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite. a-Galactosidase and P-galactosidase positive. Strain RSPS-7a is a-galactosidase negative, and strains RSG-1.2 and RSPS-7a are P-galactosidase negative. Casein, gelatin, hide powder azure, hippurate, and starch are degraded. Strains ALT-lbT and RSPS-7a utilize D-trehalose, maltose, D-fructose, D-glucose, D-mannose, sucrose, glycerol, L-arginine, L-asparagine, L-glutamate, L-glutamine, L-proline, L-serine, and pyruvate. Strain RSG-1.2 does not utilize two of these compounds, D-mannose and L-glutamine. None of the strains utilizes D-raffinose, D-cellobiose, D-melibiose, lactose, D-galactose, L-rhamnose, D-xylose, L-arabinose, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, myo-inositol, ribitol, citrate, malate, and succinate.

Name: Natrinema salaciae
Extended Metabolism: Yeast extract is required for growth. Growth is very poor under anaerobic conditions in the presence of nitrate, but no growth occurs with DMSO, l-arginine, Na2S2O3 and Na2SO4. Nitrate is reduced to nitrite. Acetate, pyruvate, succinate, fumarate, glutamate, l-alanine, l-asparagine, l-lysine, proline, l-glutamine, l-arginine, l-serine, lleucine, l-isoleucine, l-ornithine and threonine are assimilated. Acid is produced from glycerol, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, methyl-˛d glucopyranoside, arbutin, esculin ferric citrate, salicin, d-cellobiose, d-maltose, starch, glycogen, gentiobiose, d-turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, potassium 2-ketogluconate and potassium 5-ketogluconate using the API 50 CH.

Name: Chlorobium tepidum
Extended Metabolism: Obligately phototrophic and anaerobic; sulfide required for growth under all conditions. Electron donors for photoautotrophic growth include sulfide and thiosulfate. Sulfide alone supports only very poor growth, thiosulfate is required to obtain high cell yields. Acetate and pyruvate photoassimilated. Sugars and other organic or fatty acids (including propionate) not utilized. Ammonia, glutamine, and N2 serve as nitrogen sources

Name: Acidithiobacillus caldus
Extended Metabolism: Capable of chemolithoautotrophic growth with thiosulfate, tetrathionate, sulfide, sulfur and molecular hydrogen. Can grow mixotrophically with tetrathionate and glucose or yeast extract. Growth does not occur with ferrous iron or sulfidic ores, with or without an organic amendment

Name: Haloarcula amylolytica
Extended Metabolism: Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Anaerobic growth occurs in the presence of nitrate with formation of nitrite and gas. No anaerobic growth in the presence of arginine or DMSO. H2S is produced from Na2S2O3. Indole formation is positive. Tweens 20, 40, 60, 80 and starch are hydrolysed. Casein is not hydrolysed. Gelatin is liquefied. Glucose, sucrose, galactose, sorbitol, mannose, mannitol and maltose are utilized and acids are produced. No growth is observed on fructose, sorbose, xylose, lactose or d-ribose.

Name: Haloferax prahovense
Extended Metabolism:
The following substrates
are used as carbon sources: glucose, arabinose, galactose,
fructose, rhamnose, raffinose, D-xylose, maltose, sucrose,
starch, lactose, glycerol, acetate, propionate, pyruvate,
L-lactate, succinate, L-malate, fumarate, citrate, L-alanine,
L-ornithine. Acid is produced from fructose and lactose.
The following substrates are not used as carbon sources:
mannose, D-ribose, mannitol, sorbitol, glycine, L-arginine,
L-aspartate, L-glutamate and L-lysine

Name: Ferroplasma acidarmanus
Extended Metabolism: Grows chemoorganotrophically on yeast extract, Casamino Acids, and sugars and chemomixotrophically on Fe(II) and the above organic carbon sources. Facultative anaerobe, coupling oxidation of yeast extract to Fe(III) reduction.

Name: Ferroplasma acidarmanus
Extended Metabolism: Grows chemoorganotrophically on yeast extract, Casamino Acids, and sugars and chemomixotrophically on Fe(II) and the above organic carbon sources. Facultative anaerobe, coupling oxidation of yeast extract to Fe(III) reduction.

Name: Halobacterium salinarum
Extended Metabolism: bioenergetically flexible organism which can obtain energy from respiration, retinal-based photosynthesis and fermentation under various environmental conditions

Name: Alicyclobacillus tengchongensis
Extended Metabolism: Catalase-positive and oxidase-negative. Esculin, gelatin and starch are hydrolyzed, but casein and urea are not. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite. Indole is not produced. Acid is produced from arbutin, esculin, D-glucose, glycerol, salicin, D-cellobiose, D-maltose, D-melibiose, D-sucrose, Dtrehalose, glycogen, D-galactose, D-turanose, D-xylose, and methyl-α-D-glucoside, but not from adonitol, dulicitol, erythritol, D-fructose, inositol, D-mannitol, D-mannose, D-sorbitol, methyl-α-D-mannopyranoside, methyl-β-D-xylopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, D-lactose, inulin, D-melezitose, D-raffinose, L-sorbose, starch, xylitol, gentiobiose, D-lyxose, D-tagatose, L-rhamnose, D- or L-arabinose, D- or L-fucose, D- or L-arabitol, D-ribose, L-xylose, 2-ketogluconate, and 5-keto-gluconate.

Name: Haloarcula argentinensis
Extended Metabolism: Catalase and oxidase positive. Acids are produced from various sugars (sucrose, maltose, glucose, galactose, mannose, ribose, glycerol, and fructose).

Name: Halarchaeum grantii
Extended Metabolism: Capable of using sodium fumarate, sodium l-malate, sodium succinate, sodium l-glutamate and tryptone (Difco) for growth. Peptone (Difco), sodium acetate, sodium α-ketoglutarate, sodium dl-lactate and sodium pyruvate are not utilized. The type strain, MH1-243-3T, is also able to assimilate a wide range of substrates; l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, lactose (weakly), maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, raffinose, α-l-rhamnose, ribitol, ribose, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose (weakly), sucrose, trehalose, d-xylose, sodium citrate, sodium fumarate, sodium l-malate, sodium propionate, sodium succinate, l-alanine, l-arginine chloride, sodium l-aspartate, sodium l-glutamate, glycine (weakly) and l-lysine chloride.

Name: Halarchaeum nitratireducens
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase-negative. H2S is not produced from thiosulfate. Indole formation is negative. Reduces nitrate and nitrite under aerobic conditions. Does not hydrolyse starch, gelatin, Tween 80, cellulose, mannan and casein. Capable of using l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, d-xylose or sodium succinate as a sole carbon substrate. Maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, raffinose, ribitol, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, trehalose, sodium acetate, sodium citrate, sodium α-ketoglutarate, sodium dl-lactate, sodium pyruvate, l-alanine, l-arginine chloride, sodium l-aspartate, sodium l-glutamate and l-lysine chloride are not utilized as carbon sources.

Name: Halobacterium hubeiense
Note: Ancient organism isolated as dormant cells

Name: Methanosarcina barkeri
Extended Metabolism: The catabolic substrates which supported most rapid growth were H2 plus methanol; this combination sometimes allowed growth of a strain under extreme environmental conditions which prevented growth on other substrates.

Name: Petrimonas mucosa
Note: Also known as Petrimonas sp. ING2-E5A

Name: Methanoculleus bourgensis sp
Extended Metabolism: ammonia-rich mesophilic biogas processes

Name: Halarchaeum rubridurum
Extended Metabolism: Oxidase-negative; the catalase reaction is variable. H2S is not produced from thiosulfate. Indole formation is negative. Does not reduce nitrate or nitrite under aerobic conditions. Anaerobic growth with nitrate, arginine and DMSO is not observed. Does not hydrolyse starch, gelatin, Tween 80, cellulose, mannan or casein. Capable of using cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, sodium fumarate, sodium l-malate and sodium succinate as single carbon substrate, but not lactose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, α-l-rhamnose, ribitol, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, trehalose, sodium acetate, sodium α-ketoglutarate, sodium dl-lactate, sodium propionate or sodium pyruvate.

Name: Halalkalicoccus jeotgali
Extended Metabolism: The isolate is catalase-positive, oxidase-negative and does not reduce nitrate to nitrite. Glucose, sucrose, citrate, lactose and acetate can be utilized as sole carbon and energy sources.

Name: Haloterrigena jeotgali
Extended Metabolism: Anaerobic growth with nitrate occurs, but not with sulfate, thiosulfate, DMSO and TMAO. Fructose, lactose and acetate are utilized as carbon and energy sources, but sucrose, glucose, citrate and formate are not. Acid is not produced from fructose, lactose, acetate, sucrose, glucose, citrate or formate.

Name: Geoalkalibacter subterraneus
Extended Metabolism: Able to use iron(III), manganese(IV), nitrate, elemental sulfur and trimethylamine N-oxide as electron acceptors in the presence of a wide variety of electron donors, including formate, acetate, malonate, propionate, pyruvate, lactate, butyrate, isobutyrate, succinate, fumarate, valerate, isovalerate, citrate, salicylate, octanoate, p-anisate, decanoate, dodecanoate, palmitate, stearate, methanol, ethanol, glycerol, peptone, yeast extract and hydrogen. No fermentation occurs.

Name: Haloarcula hispanica
Extended Metabolism: Metabolism is strictly respiratory. Acids are produced from many sugars (arabinose, fructose, galactose, glucose, maltose, manose, sucrose, xylose). Catalase and oxidase are produced. Starch, Tween 20, 40, 60 and 80, and gelatine are hydrolyzed. Casein hydrolysis only occurs in 17% of the strains. H2S is produced from thiosulfate. Indole variable. Nitrates and nitrites are reduced with final gas production.

Name: Methanoculleus palmolei
Extended Metabolism: Cells grow on H2/CO2, formate, 2- propanol/CO2, 2-butanol/CO2 and cyclopentanol/CO2. No growth and no methane production is observed on acetate, methanol, ethanol, 1 -propanol, 2-pentanol/CO2, 2,3-butanediol, dimethylamine and lactate

Name: Streptococcus thermophilus
Extended Metabolism: metabolism fermentative. Acid produced from fructose, glucose, lactose, mannose and sucrose. Acid not produced from N-acetylglucosamine, adonitol, amygdalin, arabinose, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, gluconate, glycerol, glycogen, inulin, maltose, mannitol, methyl D-glucoside, methyl D-mannoside, methyl D-xyloside, rhamnose, salicin, sorbitol, trehalose and xylose. Variable results may be obtained for arbutin, galactose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose and ribose. Aesculin, arginine, casein, gelatin and hippurate are not hydrolyzed. Starch hydrolysis is variable. DNAase and urease are not produced. Voges-Proskauer positive. Acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, a-galactosidase, cysteine arylamidase, B-glucuronidase, a-glucosidase, B-glucosidase, a-fucosidase, pyrrolidonylarylamidase, N-acetyl-/3-glucosaminidase and valine arylamidase negative. P-Galactosidase and leucine arylamidase positive

Name: Methanococcus aeolicus
Extended Metabolism: autotrophically by reduction of CO2 to CH4, with H2 (or formate) as electron donor. Acetate, methanol, methylamines, ethanol, 1-propanol and 2-propanol are not catabolized

Name: Haloferax volcanii
Extended Metabolism: Yeast extract and tryptone are good sources of organic nutrilites. No growth anaerobically with nitrate

Name: Haloarchaeobius baliensis
Extended Metabolism: Cells are aerobic and chemoheterotrophic. Anaerobic growth with nitrate, DMSO, TMAO and l-arginine is not observed. The following substrates are utilized as single energy and carbon sources for growth: d-glucose, maltose, trehalose, sucrose, cellobiose, glycerol, starch, l-alanine, l-phenylalanine, l-proline and l-tyrosine. No growth occurred on d-fructose, d-mannose, d-galactose, melibiose, lactose, raffinose, d-arabinose, l-rhamnose, d-xylose, d-ribose, ribitol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, d-sorbose, citrate, pyruvate, succinate, malate, l-glutamate, glycine, ornithine, lactate, fumarate, acetate, l-arginine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-cysteine, l-lysine, l-methionine, l-serine or l-valine. Acid is produced from d-glucose, maltose, trehalose, sucrose, cellobiose, glycerol and starch.

Name: Halalkalicoccus tibetensis
Extended Metabolism: Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Gelatin, starch, casein and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are not hydrolysed. Reduces nitrate to nitrite. Indole is not produced. H2S is not produced from thiosulfate. Glucose, lactose, fructose, maltose, sorbose, mannitol, succinate and acetate are used as carbon sources. Does not use galactose, sucrose, mannose, arabinose, ribose, xylose, rhamnose or raffinose. Acid is not produced from glucose.

Name: Ferroplasma acidarmanus
Extended Metabolism: Grows chemoorganotrophically on yeast extract, Casamino Acids, and sugars and chemomixotrophically on Fe(II) and the above organic carbon sources. Facultative anaerobe, coupling oxidation of yeast extract to Fe(III) reduction.

Name: Naegleria fowleri
Note: It can be pathogenic in humans causing a fatal brain infection called naegleriasis or primary amoebic meningoencephalitis (PAM).

Name: Natronolimnobius baerhuensis
Extended Metabolism: Utilizes arabinose, fructose, galactose, glucose, glycerol, lactose, maltose, mannose, rhamnose, raffinose, xylose, acetate, fumarate, and pyruvate

Name: Haloarcula japonica
Extended Metabolism: Mono- and di-carbohydrates including galactose, arabinose, xylose, rhamnose, sucrose, glycerol, maltose, trehalose and cellobiose, and sugar alcohols such as mannitol and solbitol were utilized as sole carbon sources by strain TR-l with acid production. No hydrolysis of casein, gelatin or starch were observed. Reduction of nitrates with gas, production of indole and HzS were positive.

Name: Geobacillus subterraneus
Extended Metabolism: Acid but no gas is produced from cellobiose, galactose, glycerol, mannose and ribose. No acid is produced from adonitol, arabinose, inositol, raffinose, rhamnose, sorbitol or xylose. Utilizes as carbon and energy sources hydrocarbons (C10–C16), methane–naphthenic and naphthenic–aromatic oil, phenylacetate, formate, acetate, butyrate, pyruvate, benzoate, fumarate, succinate, peptone, tryptone, nutrient broth, potato agar, yeast extract, phenol, ethanol, butanol and lactate. Nitrate is reduced to dinitrogen. Does not grow autotrophically on H2 ­CO2 . Gelatin is not hydrolyzed. Starch and aesculin are degraded. Phenylalanine is not deaminated, Fe is not reduced, casein is not hydrolyzed, urea and tyrosine are not decomposed

Name: Haloarcula vallismortis
Extended Metabolism: A variety of carbohydrates are assimilated with or without acid production; soluble starch is hydrolyzed. The organism is not proteolytic; catalase, oxidase, and DNase reactions are positive; Tween 20 is slightly hydrolyzed, but Tweens 40, 60, and 80 are not.

Name: Haladaptatus paucihalophilus
Extended Metabolism: Does not ferment arginine. Capable of using single-carbon substrates. Utilizes glutamic acid, histidine, norleucine, phenylalanine, d-glucuronic acid, dextrin, aesculin, salicin, trehalose, sucrose, fructose, xylose, glucose, starch, galactose, acetate, lactate, malate, fumarate, citrate, pyruvate, mannitol and glycerol. Threonine, methionine, tyrosine, arginine, alanine, aspartic acid, glycine, lactose, succinate, sorbitol, dulcitol and 3,3-dimethylglutaric acid are not utilized as carbon sources. Produces acid when grown on sucrose, xylose, glucose, starch, fructose, galactose, mannitol and glycerol. Able to utilize complex carbon sources such as yeast extract and Casamino acids. Catalase- and oxidase-positive. Indole is produced from tryptophan. Does not reduce nitrate under aerobic conditions.

Name: Natronomonas gomsonensis
Extended Metabolism: The following substrates are utilized as single carbon and energy sources for growth: acetate, D-glucose, mannose, galactose, fructose, D-ribose, maltose, sucrose, lactose, glycerol, mannitol, pyruvate, fumarate, glycine, glutamate, alanine, arginine and aspartate. D-xylose, lysine, succinate, malate and starch are not utilized. Acid is produced from D-glucose, sucrose, fructose, maltose, and lactose.

Name: Natrinema soli
Extended Metabolism: Reduction of nitrate to nitrite is negative. Hydrolysis of casein, starch and gelatin is negative. The following substrates are utilized as sole source of carbon and energy: l-arabinose, d-galactose, d-glucose, maltose, cellobiose, raffinose, proline, glutamine, l-leucine, threonine, d-gluconate and d-glucose. Acid is not produced from any of the above-mentioned carbohydrates. H2S is not produced from thiosulfate.

Name: Methanococcus aeolicus
Extended Metabolism: autotrophically by reduction of CO2 to CH4, with H2 (or formate) as electron donor. Acetate, methanol, methylamines, ethanol, 1-propanol and 2-propanol are not catabolized

Name: Methanofollis liminatans

Name: Halarchaeum salinum

Lactose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, raffinose, ribitol, ribose, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, trehalose, sodium acetate, sodium citrate, sodium α-ketoglutarate, sodium dl-lactate, sodium propionate, sodium pyruvate, l-alanine, l-arginine chloride and l-lysine chloride are not utilized as carbon sources.
